item.title: By: Katie
item.dc:creator: Katie
item.description: Is it possible to scramble the egg mixture when adding the hot cream? My cream/white choc mixture came out tasting very eggy... but it was perfectly smooth... maybe the eggs I used were a bit too big. I have added extra white choc and a bit of vanilla extract and put it in the fridge to set, fingers crossed!
item.content:encoded: Is it possible to scramble the egg mixture when adding the hot cream? My cream/white choc mixture came out tasting very eggy… but it was perfectly smooth… maybe the eggs I used were a bit too big. I have added extra white choc and a bit of vanilla extract and put it in the fridge to set, fingers crossed!

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/choc-a-block-trifle/comment-page-1/#comment-1794">Joanne</a>.
Hi Joanne Yes, cornflour and cornstarch are the same. In Australia it's called cornflour. Thanks for visiting! Anita
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joanne.

Hi Joanne
Yes, cornflour and cornstarch are the same. In Australia it’s called cornflour.
Thanks for visiting!
Anita

item.title: By: Joanne
item.dc:creator: Joanne
item.description: Is cornflour the same as cornstarch???

item.title: By: just baked
item.dc:creator: just baked
item.description: if you add the water all at once the chocolate will not seize. dont do it 1 tablespoon at a time that is when the chocolate seizes :)
item.content:encoded: if you add the water all at once the chocolate will not seize. dont do it 1 tablespoon at a time that is when the chocolate seizes ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
Hi Ffichiban - Hehehe... I know.. :)
Hi Julia - I certainly had a bit of a sugar overload :) The recipe was in the March 2008 along with many other chocolate recipes I want to try :P
Hi Leela - They are great for a dinner party - and no one can resist them :)
Hi Maria - Hehehe, I hope to see more chocolate trifle recipe out on the net!
Hi Y - It is VERY good :) Hehehe

item.title: By: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.dc:creator: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.description: oh my god, what an awesome dessert. I've never seen a chocolate trifle before, maybe I have lived long enough yet. But this seriously looks decadent, I was drool just reading the heading!
item.content:encoded: oh my god, what an awesome dessert. I’ve never seen a chocolate trifle before, maybe I have lived long enough yet. But this seriously looks decadent, I was drool just reading the heading!

item.title: By: Leela@SheSimmers
item.dc:creator: Leela@SheSimmers
item.description: I am shamelessly drooling. These individual trifles would be a perfect make-ahead dessert for a dinner party. How can anyone resist brownies, white chocolate, cream, and Kahlua?
item.content:encoded: I am shamelessly drooling. These individual trifles would be a perfect make-ahead dessert for a dinner party. How can anyone resist brownies, white chocolate, cream, and Kahlua?

item.title: By: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.dc:creator: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.description: The picture with all the individual servings lined up is great - but I think I would have sugar overload just having all those glasses so close by. :) I don't remember seeing that recipe in Delicious last year, but there are so many. I end up with so many tags on pages that I want to come back to later. I always have way too much to try!!!
